definitions: extremely large number or quantity of things or people
large gathering of people assembled in one place
examples: A multitude of stars illuminated the desert sky
The library contained a multitude of ancient manuscripts
The multitude gathered outside the courthouse demanding justice
Jesus spoke to the multitude from the mountainside

definitions: informal term for mother used especially by children
flowering plant with showy blooms popular in autumn gardens
state of keeping quiet or saying nothing about something
examples: My mum makes the best chocolate cake ever
He still calls his mum every Sunday morning
The yellow mums brightened the autumn garden display
She wore a corsage made of white mums
Keep mum about the surprise party until Friday
The witnesses remained mum during the investigation

definitions: ancient Egyptian practice of preserving bodies through drying and wrapping
natural or artificial process that dries and preserves organic material
examples: The mummification process took seventy days to complete properly
Egyptian mummification involved removing organs and using natron salt
Natural mummification occurred in the dry desert climate
The fruit underwent mummification in the intense heat

definitions: body preserved by embalming and drying especially in ancient Egypt
informal British term for mother used by children
person wrapped in bandages resembling an Egyptian mummy
examples: The mummy of Tutankhamun was discovered in 1922
Scientists examined the mummy using advanced scanning technology
Mummy said we could have ice cream after dinner
I love you mummy, said the little girl
He dressed as a mummy for the Halloween party
The patient looked like a mummy after surgery

definitions: contagious viral infection causing swelling of the salivary glands
examples: The child contracted mumps despite being vaccinated years ago
Mumps can cause serious complications in adult males

definitions: city or town with its own local government and defined boundaries
examples: The municipality voted to increase property taxes this year
Each municipality manages its own waste collection services

definitions: military weapons, ammunition, and equipment used in warfare
projectiles and explosive devices fired from weapons
examples: The factory produced munitions during World War Two
Troops were running low on munitions after the siege
The depot stored various types of munitions safely underground
Export of munitions requires special government permits

definitions: large painting or artwork applied directly to a wall or ceiling
examples: The artist spent three months completing the downtown mural
Ancient Roman murals decorated the walls of Pompeii

definitions: artist who specializes in painting large artworks directly on walls
examples: Diego Rivera was a famous Mexican muralist
The city hired a muralist to beautify the subway station

definitions: deliberate and unlawful killing of one person by another
collective noun for a group of crows
examples: The detective investigated the murder at the mansion
Premeditated murder carries the heaviest criminal penalties
A murder of crows gathered in the old oak tree
The murder flew away when the farmer approached

definitions: person who commits the crime of deliberately killing another person
examples: The murderer was sentenced to life in prison
Police searched for the murderer using forensic evidence

definitions: low continuous indistinct sound made by voices or movement
abnormal heart sound heard through a stethoscope during examination
examples: A murmur of conversation filled the waiting room
The brook's gentle murmur was soothing to hear
The doctor detected a heart murmur during the checkup
Most innocent murmurs don't require any treatment

definitions: tissue in the body that contracts to produce movement and maintain posture
physical power or strength especially when used forcefully
examples: The athlete pulled a muscle during the sprint race
Regular exercise helps build muscle mass and strength
The company used its financial muscle to dominate competitors
You need political muscle to push through these reforms

definitions: arrangement and development of muscles in a body or body part
examples: The sculpture displayed the idealized musculature of ancient Greek athletes
Bodybuilders develop their musculature through intensive training

definitions: person or force that inspires creative work especially in arts
state of deep thought or meditation about something
examples: The poet considered nature to be his greatest muse
She became the muse for many Renaissance paintings
He would often muse about life's deeper meanings
Scientists muse over the implications of their discoveries

definitions: building where objects of historical, scientific, or artistic importance are stored and exhibited
examples: The museum houses an impressive collection of ancient artifacts
Children love visiting the natural history museum on weekends

definitions: soft shapeless mass of matter often wet or pulpy
thick porridge made from cornmeal or other grains
excessive sentimentality in speech, writing, or behavior
examples: The overcooked vegetables turned into an unappetizing mush
Rain had turned the trail into muddy mush
Prisoners ate mush for breakfast every morning
She made cornmeal mush with butter and salt
The movie was nothing but romantic mush and clichés
Stop talking such sentimental mush about the past

definitions: fleshy spore-bearing fruiting body of a fungus typically with a cap and stem
sudden rapid growth or increase in size or number
examples: Wild mushrooms should be identified carefully before eating
The pizza was topped with fresh mushrooms and peppers
Housing developments mushroomed around the city's edges
Social media use has mushroomed among teenagers recently

definitions: art of combining vocal or instrumental sounds to produce beauty and express emotion
written or printed signs representing musical sounds for performance
examples: Classical music filled the concert hall with beautiful melodies
She studied music theory at the conservatory
The pianist placed the music on the stand carefully
Can you read music or do you play by ear

definitions: stage or film production featuring songs, dancing, and spoken dialogue
examples: The high school performed the musical Grease last spring
Broadway musicals attract millions of tourists to New York

definitions: quality of having a pleasant sound or being musically talented and sensitive
examples: The poet's verses displayed remarkable musicality and rhythm
Her natural musicality made learning instruments effortless

definitions: person who plays a musical instrument or composes music professionally
examples: The musician tuned her guitar before the performance
Jazz musicians improvised throughout the entire concert

definitions: skill, knowledge, and artistic sensitivity in performing or understanding music
examples: Her exceptional musicianship earned her a scholarship to Juilliard
The conductor demanded high standards of musicianship from orchestra members

definitions: period of reflection or thought often expressed in writing or speech
examples: His philosophical musings appeared in the Sunday newspaper column
She shared her musings about life in her journal

definitions: strong-smelling substance secreted by male musk deer used in perfumes
heavy base note in perfumes with sweet, powdery, animalistic qualities
examples: Natural musk comes from glands of the musk deer
The cologne had notes of musk and sandalwood
Synthetic musk replaced animal-derived musk in modern perfumes
The room was heavy with the musk of incense

definitions: muzzle-loading shoulder gun used from the 16th to 19th centuries
examples: Revolutionary War soldiers carried muskets into battle
The museum displayed a collection of antique muskets

definitions: soldier armed with a musket especially in European armies of past centuries
examples: The Three Musketeers served in the French king's guard
Musketeers formed the backbone of 17th century armies

definitions: large semiaquatic North American rodent with dense fur and musky smell
examples: Muskrats built their lodge in the marsh reeds
Trappers once hunted muskrats for their valuable fur

definitions: lightweight cotton fabric in plain weave used for clothing and household items
examples: She sewed curtains from white muslin fabric
The dress was made of delicate printed muslin

definitions: edible bivalve mollusk with dark elongated shell found in seas and rivers
examples: Fresh mussels steamed in white wine make a delicious appetizer
Mussels attached themselves to the dock pilings

definitions: something that is necessary, required, or highly recommended
freshly crushed grape juice before or during fermentation for wine
examples: Comfortable shoes are a must for the hiking trip
This book is a must for anyone interested in history
The winemaker tested the sugar content of the must
Fermentation converts must into wine over several weeks

definitions: strip of hair grown on the upper lip above the mouth
examples: He trimmed his mustache carefully every morning
The detective twirled his handlebar mustache thoughtfully

definitions: small hardy wild horse of the North American western plains
examples: Wild mustangs roamed freely across the Nevada desert
The cowboy tamed the spirited mustang with patience

definitions: pungent yellow or brown paste made from crushed mustard seeds
plant with yellow flowers whose seeds are used to make condiment
brownish-yellow color resembling the condiment
examples: He spread mustard on his hot dog generously
Dijon mustard adds flavor to salad dressings
Mustard plants covered the field in bright yellow blooms
Farmers grow mustard as both a crop and cover plant
She painted the kitchen walls a warm mustard color
The mustard sweater matched her autumn outfit perfectly

definitions: formal gathering of troops for inspection or roll call
summoning or gathering of strength, courage, or resources
examples: The sergeant called a muster at dawn for inspection
Ships' crews assembled for muster on the main deck
She couldn't muster the courage to speak publicly
The team mustered all their energy for the final push

definitions: organism or cell with genetic material altered through mutation
examples: Scientists studied the mutant fruit flies in the laboratory
The mutant strain showed resistance to the antibiotic

definitions: permanent alteration in DNA sequence that affects genetic information
process of changing or the state of being changed
examples: The mutation caused the bacteria to become drug-resistant
Genetic mutations can be inherited or occur spontaneously
Language undergoes constant mutation as society evolves
The mutation of the original plan confused team members

definitions: person unable to speak due to physical or psychological reasons
device that softens or dampens the sound of a musical instrument
examples: The witness remained mute throughout the entire trial
Sign language helps mute individuals communicate effectively
The trumpet player inserted a mute for the jazz solo
The violin's mute created a softer, mellow tone

definitions: infliction of violent or disfiguring injury on a body or body part
examples: The sculpture suffered mutilation during the vandalism attack
Doctors repaired the mutilation caused by the accident

definitions: open rebellion against authority especially by sailors against ship officers
examples: The crew staged a mutiny against the cruel captain
The famous mutiny on the Bounty occurred in 1789

definitions: dog of mixed or uncertain breed often used affectionately
examples: The lovable mutt wagged his tail at everyone
She adopted a mutt from the local animal shelter

definitions: low indistinct utterance often expressing dissatisfaction or complaint
examples: He muttered complaints under his breath about the delay
The crowd began to mutter when the announcement was made

definitions: meat from an adult sheep used as food
examples: The restaurant served tender mutton curry with rice
Mutton requires longer cooking than lamb to become tender

definitions: projecting nose and mouth area of an animal especially a dog
device placed over an animal's mouth to prevent biting
open end of a firearm's barrel from which projectiles exit
examples: The dog's muzzle was wet from drinking water
The horse nuzzled her hand with its soft muzzle
The veterinarian used a muzzle during the examination
City law required muzzles for certain dog breeds
Smoke rose from the rifle's muzzle after firing
The muzzle velocity determines the bullet's initial speed

definitions: vision defect where distant objects appear blurred while near objects are clear
lack of foresight or inability to think about long-term consequences
examples: His myopia required strong prescription glasses for driving
Myopia affects millions of people worldwide increasingly
Corporate myopia prevented them from seeing market changes
Political myopia led to poor long-term policy decisions

definitions: extremely large number or variety of things that seems infinite
examples: The night sky displayed a myriad of twinkling stars
She faced myriad challenges in her new position

definitions: fragrant gum resin from Arabian trees used in perfumes and incense
examples: The wise men brought gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh
Ancient Egyptians used myrrh in their embalming process

definitions: evergreen shrub with fragrant white flowers and aromatic dark berries
examples: The garden path was lined with fragrant myrtle bushes
Myrtle leaves were used in ancient ceremonial wreaths

definitions: something difficult or impossible to understand, explain, or identify
novel, play, or film dealing with puzzling crime and its solution
examples: The disappearance of the ship remains an unsolved mystery
Scientists investigate the mysteries of deep ocean life
She enjoys reading murder mysteries before bedtime
The mystery kept readers guessing until the final chapter

definitions: person who seeks unity with divine through contemplation and self-surrender
examples: The mystic spent years in solitary meditation
Medieval mystics wrote about their spiritual visions
